intro: Gomphrena gardneri, commonly known as the Mexican feather grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery bracts that resemble plumes. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of red, pink, and purple, which bloom in late summer to early fall. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for drought-tolerant gardens. Gomphrena gardneri is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
